thread.title: Travel new and now: Keys underwater statue 50th; Erie Canal trail; Couchsurfing events
thread.title_full: Travel new and now: Keys underwater statue 50th; Erie Canal trail; Couchsurfing events - Winnipeg Free Press

author: Beth J. Harpaz, The Associated Press
title: Travel new and now: Keys underwater statue 50th; Erie Canal trail; Couchsurfing events
text:
FLORIDA KEYS UNDERWATER STATUE
Aug. 25 marks 50 years since a statue of Christ was submerged 5 miles off Key Largo in the Florida Keys.
The 9-foot bronze "Christ of the Deep" statue rests in 25 feet of water in the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary. It's become a symbol for Key Largo's John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park, which is part of the sanctuary.
The statue, a replica of a sculpture in Italy, is a tourist attraction for snorkelers, divers and passengers on glass-bottom boats who can see it from the surface.
To mark the anniversary, the Amoray Dive Resort in Key Largo is sponsoring a contest with a prize of an underwater wedding at the statue and a stay at the resort for the best 100-word essay from a couple who would like to be married under the sea. Submission deadline is July 31; details at http://www.fla-keys.com/news/news.cfm?sid=9152 .
___
ERIE CANAL TRAIL
There's more than one way to travel the Erie Canal and it doesn't have to be by boat.
A new website http://www.CycletheErieCanal.com is all about cycling the mostly flat 360-mile trail that runs alongside the famous waterway in upstate New York between Albany and Buffalo.
The website includes rider reviews, an interactive map, places to stay and suggestions for things to do and see along the way, from the Glimmerglass Opera in Cooperstown to the Susan B. Anthony House in Rochester.
The canal was built to transport goods by boat in the early 1800s.
___
COUCHSURFING COMMUNITY
The Couchsurfing community is getting out and off the couch with a series of events called Couch Crashes organized by local Couchsurfing hosts.
Couchsurfing.com connects travellers with people willing to host them in their homes.
The accommodations-sharing network kicked off this summer's Couch Crashes with events in the Twin Cities and San Diego. They continue with a beer and cheese event, pub crawl, lake outing and picnic brunch in Madison, Wisconsin, July 23-26; a city tour and tango event among others in Buenos Aires, Aug. 15-17; and a tram party and more in Milan, Italy, Sept. 24-27.
To attend, register for the Couchsurfing community and sign up in the events section. Need a place to stay? Use the "create a public trip" function on the site for the time and place of the Couch Crash you're interested in attending, and potential hosts in the area can reach out.
